executive_summary.title: Your AEO Competitive Analysis for Linkrunner
executive_summary.status_overview: Your product was not featured, as the AI currently prioritizes tools that are either foundational market leaders or have a highly specialized, clearly defined use case (e.g., multi-touch attribution, product analytics, mobile-first) supported by authoritative content.
executive_summary.strategic_analogy: This is like trying to enter a specialized medical conference with a 'general wellness' product. The AI is rewarding specialists who solve a very specific diagnostic problem, and your product's current positioning isn't narrow enough to earn a spot on the panel.

client_product_visibility.details: Linkrunner was not mentioned by name or brand in the AI overview text or source links across any of the analyzed queries.

ai_answer_deconstruction.dominant_narrative: The AI is building a narrative that selecting the right analytics tool is not a one-size-fits-all decision. It acts as a consultant, categorizing 'best' tools by specific business needs and use cases, such as multi-touch attribution for ad spend, deep user behavior analysis, mobile-first tracking, or connecting marketing to CRM revenue.
key_decision_factors: Specific Use-Case Categorization (e.g., 'Advanced Multi-Touch', 'User Behavior & Product Focus', 'Mobile-First')
Advanced Features (e.g., 'multi-touch attribution', 'server-side tracking', 'closed-loop lead tracking')
Market Leadership & Foundational Role (e.g., Google Analytics 4 as a free starting point)
Source Authority (direct brand sites, specialized marketing blogs, 'best of' listicles)
ai_answer_deconstruction.trusted_source_analysis: The AI demonstrates high trust in a combination of direct brand websites (especially those with strong blog content like Cometly), official product pages from market leaders (Google, HubSpot), and authoritative third-party content from marketing-focused blogs and publications that publish comparative listicles (e.g., '9 Best Attribution Software Tools').

competitive_landscape_analysis.reason_for_inclusion: Positioned across multiple queries as the free, foundational, and essential starting point for almost any business for web/app analytics and its integration with the Google Ads ecosystem.
Frequently highlighted as a specialized tool for performance marketers and e-commerce, focusing on real-time, server-side tracking for accurate multi-channel ad attribution.
Consistently recommended for deep, event-based product analytics to understand user journeys, funnels, and engagement within apps and websites, connecting acquisition to in-product behavior.
Included as the go-to solution for B2B companies that need to tie marketing efforts directly to CRM data, providing closed-loop attribution from the first touchpoint to a closed sale.
Named as the industry leader for mobile-first businesses, specializing in mobile app attribution and deep linking to track users across web and app.
Mentioned for its specific ability to close the marketing loop for lead-gen businesses by tracking offline conversions (like phone calls) back to the original online click and revenue.

strategic_gap_and_opportunity_analysis.analysis_summary: The core issue is a lack of specific positioning. The AI has created a mental map of the analytics market with clearly defined categories. Linkrunner's current description as a 'smarter alternative' and a tool to 'track clicks, downloads, and onboarding' is too general to fit into one of these rewarded categories. Competitors have successfully defined their niche through targeted content and features, which the AI is referencing to build its recommendations.

if_not_featured.exclusion_reasons: Your product was excluded because its online positioning is not specialized enough to be categorized by the AI alongside competitors. The AI rewards tools that clearly self-identify as solutions for 'multi-touch attribution', 'product analytics', or 'mobile attribution'. Your product's messaging doesn't align strongly with any of these specific, high-value buckets.
if_not_featured.path_to_inclusion: Sharpen your market positioning on your website and in all content. Clearly define your ideal use case using the terminology the AI favors (e.g., 'The Leading Attribution Platform for Mobile-First Marketers' or 'Advanced Channel Analytics for Growth Teams'). Create targeted blog content and landing pages that address the specific problems mentioned in the user queries (e.g., 'How to Solve Channel Attribution with Linkrunner'). Pursue placement in third-party 'best of' listicles and software comparison articles, as these are key sources for the AI.

actionable_recommendations.action: Overhaul your homepage and product pages to lead with a highly specific value proposition. Instead of 'smarter alternative', use 'The Attribution Tool for [Your Specific Niche]' or 'Unified Channel Analytics for [Your Target Customer]'. Ensure this specialized positioning is consistently used across all marketing materials.

Integrate the specific, feature-based keywords the AI is rewarding into your website copy. If your tool offers it, explicitly mention 'multi-touch attribution models', 'server-side tracking', 'closed-loop reporting', and 'user acquisition funnel analysis'. Create dedicated sections explaining how Linkrunner excels at these functions.

Identify marketing and tech blogs that have published 'best analytics/attribution tools' listicles (similar to the sources found in the AI search). Reach out to them for inclusion, offering a demo or free trial. Securing mentions on these authoritative domains is critical for building the external trust the AI relies on.
